revised_title: The Extent of Steapsin's Ability to Hydrolyze Fats
tldr: This study investigates the ability of steapsin, an enzyme found in the pancreas, to break down fats outside the organism. The authors found that steapsin can hydrolyze fats to a significant extent, with the highest percentage of hydrolysis reaching 86.7%. This research demonstrates the power of steapsin as a fat-splitting enzyme and opens up further avenues for studying its action in the presence of other substances.
